I can't wait for them to pull out some Wittgenstein to tell us the definition of what a game is.  Can you define what it is for something to be a game? Wittgenstein didn't believe that there is a single definition but there are family resemblances.  This means there are commonalities that are shared between things that we call games. There are no specific set of characteristics but a ton of characteristics that some games have and some don't that define what a game is.

EXACT same gaming beginnings! I had the TI-99/4A and it was my intro into programming too! I totally had the cord running to the tape player too to record my BASIC programs. Car Wars, Hunt the Wampus, Chess, Alpiner, and A-Maze-ing were my intro in to computer gaming. Followed into Atari 2600 with my favorites (not including top ten listers) being Berserker, Demon Wars, Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back, River Raid, Star Strike, and Circus Atari. When I turned 9 I finally saved up enough for my parents to match my funds and got an NES. My PS1 was the last console I purchased as I got into PC gaming in 99, not long after getting into P&P RPG's.

Can't wait to see what you have in store for us Andre. Looking forward to it!
